paper_abstract: Remarkably, Singapore as one of today's hotspots for bioinformatics and computational biology research appeared de novo out of pioneering efforts of engaged local individuals in the early 90-s that, supported with increasing public funds from 1996 on, morphed into the present vibrant research community. This article brings to mind the pioneers, their first successes and early institutional developments.
paper_title: Unix interfaces, Kleisli, bucandin structure, etc. - The heroic beginning of bioinformatics in Singapore
